content.body: It looks like the spec, Blink, and WebKit think that `window.stop()` should prevent `DOMContentLoaded` from firing. Gecko fires it. I can find only on WPT that tests this and that expect the Gecko behavior. Am I missing something or have I found a basic interop issue that has remarkably little spec-based WPT coverage?
content.formatted_body: It looks like the spec, Blink, and WebKit think that window.stop() should prevent DOMContentLoaded from firing. Gecko fires it. I can find only on WPT that tests this and that expect the Gecko behavior. Am I missing something or have I found a basic interop issue that has remarkably little spec-based WPT coverage?

content.body: It does look somewhat nicely factored, so it might have gotten updated without all corner cases being tested (and in particular how it interacts with the parser might well have been overlooked)
